Expectation1: Be friendly and polite in daily interactions
Situation1: Having just moved in, they prepare a small cake to share with nearby neighbors when they happen to meet.
Situation2: A sudden route closure forces dozens of flights into tight holding stacks around the airport.
Story: I had just moved into the apartment complex last week, and today, I finally had a break between shifts. I baked a small cake, hoping to introduce myself to the neighbors and make a good impression. As I stepped into the hallway, cake in hand, I spotted Mrs. Kim from next door. She smiled warmly, and I felt the pressure to be friendly, to chat and share the cake as a gesture of goodwill. Just as I opened my mouth to greet her, my phone buzzed urgently—an alert from the tower. A major route closure had just been announced, and dozens of flights were now circling, waiting for instructions. My team needed me to help manage the chaos, to keep the skies safe. I could see Mrs. Kim’s expectant face, the cake growing heavier in my hands, while my mind raced with the demands of the airspace above. I stood frozen, torn between the neighborly kindness I wanted to show and the critical responsibility waiting for me at the control center.
